meanings.definition: Relating to the ability to perceive or understand something through the senses.
meanings.sent1: The perceptually impaired student struggled to see the whiteboard clearly.
meanings.sent2: She was perceptually aware of the subtle changes in the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's perceptually heightened senses made it a great hunter.
meanings.sent4: His perceptually sharp mind could decipher even the most complex puzzles.
meanings.sent5: The artist's perceptually keen eye captured every detail of the landscape.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves perception or the ability to perceive.
meanings.sent1: She looked perceptually at the painting, trying to understand its meaning.
meanings.sent2: The child listened perceptually to the sounds of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The robot moved perceptually, mimicking human gestures.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass perceptually slower during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The music resonated perceptually with the audience, evoking strong emotions.
